section_id: ## 1. Causal Set Theory: Axioms and Framework

hints.label: def-causal-set-standard
hints.title: Causal Set (Bombelli et al. 1987)
hints.content:
30: :label: def-causal-set-standard
31: 
32: A **causal set** $(C, \prec)$ is a locally finite partially ordered set (poset) satisfying:
33: 
34: **Axiom CS1 (Irreflexivity)**: For all $e \in C$, $e \not\prec e$
35: 
36: **Axiom CS2 (Transitivity)**: For all $e_1, e_2, e_3 \in C$, if $e_1 \prec e_2$ and $e_2 \prec e_3$, then $e_1 \prec e_3$
37: 
38: **Axiom CS3 (Local Finiteness)**: For all $e_1, e_2 \in C$, the set $\{e \in C : e_1 \prec e \prec e_2\}$ is finite
39: 
40: **Physical interpretation**:
41: - Elements $e \in C$ represent spacetime events

27: ### 1.1. Standard Causal Set Definition
28: 
29: :::{prf:definition} Causal Set (Bombelli et al. 1987)
30: :label: def-causal-set-standard
31: 
32: A **causal set** $(C, \prec)$ is a locally finite partially ordered set (poset) satisfying:
33: 
34: **Axiom CS1 (Irreflexivity)**: For all $e \in C$, $e \not\prec e$
35: 
36: **Axiom CS2 (Transitivity)**: For all $e_1, e_2, e_3 \in C$, if $e_1 \prec e_2$ and $e_2 \prec e_3$, then $e_1 \prec e_3$
37: 
38: **Axiom CS3 (Local Finiteness)**: For all $e_1, e_2 \in C$, the set $\{e \in C : e_1 \prec e \prec e_2\}$ is finite
39: 
40: **Physical interpretation**:
41: - Elements $e \in C$ represent spacetime events
42: - $e_1 \prec e_2$ means "$e_1$ causally precedes $e_2$" (future light cone)

hints.label: def-poisson-sprinkling
hints.title: Poisson Sprinkling
hints.content:
49: :label: def-poisson-sprinkling
50: 
51: Given a Lorentzian manifold $(M, g_{\mu\nu})$ with volume element $dV = \sqrt{-\det g} \, d^d x$, a **Poisson sprinkling** with density $\rho$ is:
52: 
53: 1. **Sample points**: Draw $N$ points $\{x_i\}$ from $M$ with probability density $p(x) = \rho \cdot \sqrt{-\det g(x)} / V_{\text{total}}$
54: 
55: 2. **Define order**: $e_i \prec e_j$ iff $x_i$ is in the causal past of $x_j$ (i.e., timelike/lightlike separated with $t_i < t_j$)

54: 
55: 2. **Define order**: $e_i \prec e_j$ iff $x_i$ is in the causal past of $x_j$ (i.e., timelike/lightlike separated with $t_i < t_j$)
